Package com.example.librarian_module.sys

Class BookDB

java.lang.Object
com.example.librarian_module.sys.BookDB
public class BookDB extends Object
The class BookDB manages book database files and synchronizes their content with the data in system memory. There are three database files: book, book edition, and book copy. The first two files have variable-length records to save space. The book copy file have fixed-length records, so it is easier and more efficient to update its data when needed.
Since:
2022-03-04

  • Method Details

    • load

      public static void load()
      Load the data in the book, book edition, book copy database files into system memory at startup.

    • addBook

      public static void addBook(String bid, String tle, String lname, String fname, String ed, String ISBN, String yr, String pgs, String cps, String cat)
      Add a book with specified parameters to the database files.
      Parameters:
      bid - ID used as the key of the book.
      tle - Title of the book.
      lname - Last name of the author of the book.
      fname - First name of the author of the book.
      ed - An integer representing the edition of the book.
      ISBN - International Standard Book Number of the book.
      yr - Published year of the book.
      pgs - Number of pages of the book.
      cps - Number of copies of the book.
      cat - Genre of the book.

    • addNewCopy

      public static void addNewCopy(String bid, String ed, int cid)
      Add a new copy of a book with the specified book ID, edition, and Copy ID to the database file.
      Parameters:
      bid - ID used as the key of the book.
      ed - An integer representing the edition of the book.
      cid - Copy ID of this copy of the book.

    • updateCopy

      public static void updateCopy(String bid, int ed, int cid, boolean status, LocalDate begin, LocalDate due, String bwrid)
      Update the data of the copy of the book with the specified parameters in the database.
      Parameters:
      bid - ID used as the key of the book.
      ed - An integer representing the edition of the book.
      cid - Copy ID of this copy of the book.
      status - Login status of this copy of the book.
      begin - Sign out date of the book.
      due - Due day of the book.
      bwrid - ID of the borrower of the book.
